snippet: The deadly earthquakes in Iran over the weekend have raised worries among Iranian-Americans about where to send donations because of financial sanctions imposed by the United States.
abstract: Deadly double earthquakes in Iran, the first natural disaster there since the United States imposed onerous financial sanctions on that country because of its disputed nuclear program, raises worries among Iranian-Americans about where to send donations, and whether such aid is even legal; American officials say that humanitarian aid for victims of the disaster is exempt from sanctions.

byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: The deadly earthquakes in Iran over the weekend have raised worries among Iranian-Americans about where to send donations because of financial sanctions imposed by the United States.

headline.seo: Confusion Arises Over How to Help Iran Quake Victims
headline.main: Confusion Over How to Aid Iran Quake Victims
headline.print_headline: Confusion Over How to Aid Iran Quake Victims
